inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Patient has HCV Cirrhosis (tx with interferon x2 with no response)

inclusion.criterion: cirrhosis not amenable to current therapies
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Liver function tests showed a striking increase in his total and direct bilirubin since last visit. Another worrisome feature was the increase in the patient's AFP.

inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: This could be progression of cirrhosis as he failed interferon twice.

inclusion.criterion: Karnofsky performance rating of at least 50%
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: mentally alert and able to give informed consent
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Patient was given a presumptive diagnosis of hepatic encephalopathy and started on lactulose.

inclusion.criterion: female patients who are menopausal, or of childbearing age who are surgically sterile or practicing birth control (chemical or mechanical)
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: no corticosteroid or narcotic therapy 24 hrs prior to infusion
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: asthma, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, unstable cardiovascular diseases (congestive heart failure, symptoms of coronary artery disease, cardiac arrhythmias, poorly controlled hypertension)
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: seizure disorders, primary central nervous system (CNS) tumors or known brain metastases
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: Patient has HCV Cirrhosis and failed interferon twice. He is to follow-up as an outpatient to work this up.
